Field Detail

workingDirectory

@Nullable
protected final File workingDirectory
If specified, working directory will be different from project root.

Constructor Detail

ShellCommand

protected ShellCommand()
Creates a new ShellCommand using the default logic to return a description from getDescription(ExecutionContext).

ShellCommand

protected ShellCommand(String description)
Parameters:
description - to return as the value of getDescription(ExecutionContext). By default, getDescription(ExecutionContext) returns a formatted version of the value returned by getShellCommand(ExecutionContext); however, if setup(ExecutionContext) is overridden, then it is likely that getShellCommand(ExecutionContext) cannot return a value until execute(ExecutionContext) has been invoked. Because getDescription(ExecutionContext) may be invoked before execute(ExecutionContext) (usually for logging purposes), this constructor should be used if getShellCommandInternal(ExecutionContext) cannot be invoked before setup(ExecutionContext).

ShellCommand

protected ShellCommand(File workingDirectory)
Method Detail

getWorkingDirectory

@Nullable
protected File getWorkingDirectory()
Get the working directory for this command.

Returns:
working directory specified on construction (null if project directory will be used).

shouldRecordStdout

protected boolean shouldRecordStdout()
Returns:
whether stdout should be recorded when this command is executed. If this returns true, then the stdout will be available via getStdOut().

execute

public int execute(ExecutionContext context)
Specified by:
execute in interface Command

getShellCommand

public final ImmutableList<String> getShellCommand(ExecutionContext context)
This method is idempotent.

Returns:
the shell command arguments

getShellCommandInternal

protected abstract ImmutableList<String> getShellCommandInternal(ExecutionContext context)
Implementations of this method should not have any observable side-effects. If any I/O needs to be done to produce the shell command arguments, then it should be done in setup(ExecutionContext).

getDescription

public final String getDescription(ExecutionContext context)
Specified by:
getDescription in interface Command

shouldPrintStdErr

protected boolean shouldPrintStdErr(ExecutionContext context)
Returns:
whether the stderr of the shell command, when executed, should be printed to the stderr of the specified ExecutionContext. If false, stderr will only be printed on error and only if verbosity is set to standard information.

getEnvironmentVariables

public ImmutableMap<String,String> getEnvironmentVariables()
By default, this method returns an empty map.

getStdOut

public final String getStdOut()
Returns:
the stdout of this ShellCommand or throws an exception if the stdout was not recorded

setup

protected void setup(ExecutionContext context)
              throws IOException
This method will be invoked exactly once at the start of execute(ExecutionContext). Most shell commands will not need to override this method, as all the information that is needed to return a value for getShellCommand(ExecutionContext) should be passed into the constructor. In rare cases, some information to produce the shell command arguments will not be available until runtime. In such rare cases, such logic should be added here.

Throws:
IOException
